name: Riley Sinema
title: Graduate Student at BYU
about: I'm a computer science graduate student at Brigham Young University with a passion for solving complex problems at the intersection of software engineering and artificial intelligence. My academic journey began with a bachelor's in computer science from BYU, where I discovered my fascination with machine learning and its real-world applications.

Throughout my academic and professional experiences, I've developed a versatile skill set spanning full-stack development, data science, and machine learning. I particularly enjoy working on projects that challenge me to think creatively and push the boundaries of what's possible with technology.

Currently, my research focuses on deep learning uncertainty quantification, where I'm working to improve how models evaluate uncertainty. When I'm not coding or conducting research, I enjoy mentoring fellow students as a teaching assistant for database design courses, helping others navigate the complexities of data systems.

I believe in building technology that solves meaningful problems and enhances human capabilities. My goal is to continue growing as a developer and researcher while contributing to advancements in machine learning and software engineering that make a positive impact.

projects.title: Researching Deep Learning Calibration
projects.description: Creating a new calibration method for deep learning models that is able to evaluate uncertainty on a per instance basis.

projects.title: EBook Vector Database
projects.description: A vector database that allows me to query all the eBooks on my machine based on a natural language query.

projects.title: Personalized RAG Chatbot
projects.description: A RAG chatbot that is able to answer questions about me based on data from my resume, projects, transcripts, and other sources.

projects.title: Gym Tracker Web App
projects.description: Group project lead by me to create a web app that allows users to track their gym progress and create custom workout plans.

projects.title: Codenames AI Agent
projects.description: A creative agent that works as the Spymaster for the game Codenames. Uses a LLM and agentic flow to create a creative and effective clue for its team based on the current game state.

projects.title: Training a Bayesian LLM
projects.description: Using Bayesian methods to train LLMs that can quantify their uncertainty about their generated outputs.

projects.title: Creative Photography Assistant System
projects.description: A creative system that takes as input a picture that was taken by the user, evaluates the aesthetic value of the picture, finds transformations that improve the aesthetic quality of the image, and then makes suggestions to the user how they improve their photography skills to take more aesthetic pictures in the future.

projects.title: AWS Cloud Server Using Terraform
projects.description: Designing a cost-effective and secure cloud hosted game server. Architecture includes EC2 instance, proper network security configurations, Lambda function to start/stop/check status of server, etc., all set up and versioned using Terraform for Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
